greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Values of k from A061092.
comment: A061092 is: a(0) = 1; for n>0 a(n) is the smallest prime, larger than a(n-1), of the form k*a(n-1) + 1. - Corrected by _Zak Seidov_, Oct 03 2015
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..200
mathematica: a = {2}; b = {1}; Do[k = 1; p = a[[n - 1]]; While[! PrimeQ[k p + 1], k++]; AppendTo[a, k p + 1]; AppendTo[b, k], {n, 2, 60}]; b (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 03 2015, after _Robert G. Wilson v_ at A061092 *)
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Oct 26 2005, Dec 14 2006
ext: Corrected and extended by _T. D. Noe_, Mar 10 2007
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 08 2008 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_
